title: Cloud Shell - Deploy an App Engine app by using Cloud Shell
abstract:
# Cloud Shell - Deploy an App Engine app by using Cloud Shell
# Deploy an App Engine app by using Cloud Shell
This page outlines how to quickly deploy an App Engine app from a sample application using Cloud Shell.
content:
## Before you begin
## Deploy an application
- At the top of the Google Cloud console window, click **Activate Cloud Shell** :This launches Cloud Shell session in a frame at the bottom of the [Google Cloud console](http://console.cloud.google.com) .
- Clone a sample app and run it locally in the Cloud Shell session using the App Engine development server:```
git clone https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/appengine-guestbook-python \&& cd appengine-guestbook-python \&& dev_appserver.py ./app.yaml
```
- To connect to the development server, click **Web Preview** and then choose **Preview on port 8080** .Cloud Shell opens the preview URL on its proxy service in a new browser window.
- To open the code editor, click from the Cloud Shell menu to edit your cloned app.
- Change the text in `index.html` :In the code editor, double-click `index.html` to open the file for edit and then change the text in `index.html` from to You'll see your change in Cloud Shell's output. To see the changes, refresh your previewed app.
- Stop the development server:After you've previewed the App Engine app, to stop the development server, press `Ctrl` + `C` in your Cloud Shell session.
- Initialize your App Engine app:Create an App Engine app tied to your project, if you haven't already, and choose its region:```
gcloud app create --project=[YOUR_PROJECT_NAME]
```
- Deploy the app to App Engine:```
gcloud app deploy ./index.yaml ./app.yaml
```
- Open your application in your web browser. The URL is `https://<PROJECT_ID>.<REGION-ID>.r.appspot.com/` .Deployment could take a few minutes to complete. If the application is not fully deployed, an error message is displayed in the web browser. Refresh the browser to see the deployed application.
- To avoid unnecessary billing, disable your app:To disable the app you just deployed, go to App Engine in Google Cloud console and select **Settings** > **Application Settings** > **Disable Application** .
## What's next
- [Choose an App Engine environment](/appengine/docs/the-appengine-environments)
